title: Former ODU star wide receiver Tre  Brown commits to LSU – Daily Press
body_text:
COLLEGE FOOTBALL
Former Old Dominion wide receiver Tre’ Brown indicated on social media Tuesday that he has committed to LSU out of the transfer portal.
On3 Sports and PFF College reported his commitment to the Tigers.
The sophomore from Savannah, Georgia, led the Monarchs with 762 receiving yards on 38 catches and had four touchdowns this season. His 20.1 yards per catch led the Sun Belt Conference.
Brown will have two years of eligibility remaining.
WR Edrine will return to UVA
University of Virginia wide receiver Jahmal Edrine will return to the Cavaliers next season, the program announced Tuesday.
The 6-3, 221-pound Fort Lauderdale, Florida, native caught 46 passes for 564 yards, ranking third on the team in both categories, and a touchdown this season.
Meanwhile, UVA starting cornerback Emmanuel Karnley has entered the transfer portal, according to CBS Sports and 247 Sports. The Antioch, California, native had 26 tackles, eight passes defended and an interception this season.
- Longtime Virginia Tech radio play-by-play voice Bill Roth has been named the Virginia Sportscaster of the Year for a record 13th time by the National Sports Media Association. He’s been Virginia Tech’s football play-by-play broadcaster for 31 seasons.
- Missouri defensive end Javion Hilson (6-4, 225) has committed to Virginia Tech, according to Tech Sideline and On3 Sports. The former top-100 recruit redshirted this season and will have four years of eligibility left.
- Virginia Tech kicker John Love announced on social media that he will return to the Hokies for his fifth year next season. The Spartanburg, South Carolina, native made 15 of 20 field goals and all 25 of his extra-point attempts this past season.
- Virginia Tech defensive lineman Ben Bell has accepted an invitation to the Hula Bowl on Saturday in DeLand, Florida. Bell had 40 tackles and 2.5 sacks this season. He will join Hokies quarterback Kyron Drones in the game.
- Three Old Dominion players — QB Colton Joseph, OL Maarten Woudsma and CB Zion Frink — and four William & Mary players — TE Jackson Blee, LB Jaden Boring, S David Roulley and LB Jake Worthen — made the College Sports Communicators Academic All-District Team.
HIGH SCHOOL TRACK AND FIELD
Hickory quartet headed to NYC
The Hickory High boys 4×800-meter relay team has been invited to compete at the 118th Millrose Games on Feb. 1 at the Armory in New York City.
The meet is the premier indoor track and field event and features elite professional, collegiate and high school athletes each year.
The Hawks earned an invitation after the team of Bryce Edmonson, Daniel Mudd, Zach Schubert and Tristan Fancher ran a nation-best 7 minutes, 58.94 seconds on Dec. 15. Their time is still the fastest time in the nation this season.
Hampton Roads athletes have been invited to this prestigious meet over the years, including Bayside grad Andrew Salvodon, who competed in the 500 meters last season.
Other former Hampton Roads athletes who have competed at the Millrose Games include Heritage sprinter Madison Whyte (2023), Virginia Beach’s Micayah Holland (2023), Suffolk’s Michaela Rose (2019), Portsmouth’s LaShawn Merrit (2013), Ocean Lakes’ Audrey Batzel (2012), Kellam’s Bobby Peavey (2009), Hickory’s Jennifer Boyd (2003) and Kellam’s Jud Sarver (1994). Sarver is the current track coach at Hickory.
Briefly
- The Old Dominion men’s basketball team will host Ohio University in the second round of the MAC-Sun Belt Challenge on Feb. 7. The ODU women will also play Ohio in the event, but on the road.
- Norfolk State men’s basketball assistant coach Leonard Fairley has been named to the 2025 Silver Waves Media Rising Stars Mid-Major Assistant Coaches and GMs List.
- William & Mary’s Julie Addison has been named the CAA Co-Swimmer of the Week. She won two individual events and a relay in a dual meet victory over George Washington.
- Gloucester High’s Hayden Simmons and William Trueblood have made the VHSL Class 4 all-state boys volleyball first team. Gloucester’s Grayson Shield, Denbigh’s Reyver Dela Cruz and Phoebus’ Cameron Washinton were on the second team.
